article: Many years ago I was on a bicycle trip through the countryside. Suddenly rain began to fall, but strange to _ , several hundred yards ahead of me the sun shone brilliantly. Riding, however, as rapidly as I could, I found it _ to get into the clear. The clouds with their rain kept advancing faster than I could race forward. I continued this _ contest for an exhausting half hour, _ realizing that I could not win my way to the bright area ahead of me. Then it dawned upon me that I was _ my strength in unimportant hurry, while paying no attention to the landscape for the sake of which I was making the trip. Indeed, there was much to look at which might otherwise have escaped me. As I gazed about with sharpened _ , I saw colours and lines and shapes that would have appeared _ under brilliant light. The rain mists and the fresh clearness of the different greens were so _ . My annoyance at the rain was gone and my eagerness to _ it disappeared. It had provided me with a new view that the _ of beauty and satisfaction may be found close at hand within the _ of one's own sensibilities. It made me think about other matters to which this incident was _ . I realized that there is no sense in my _ to flee from circumstances which cannot be avoided. I might just bravely _ them and they would turn to good account. I know that half the battle is _ if I can face trouble with courage. It has become ever clearer to _ that danger is far from disaster, that defeat may be the forerunner of final _ , and that all achievement is dangerously weak _ based on enduring principles of moral conduct.
